title: I Cannot Write My Life | Mbaye Lo | University of North Carolina Press

last_post.content:
*now available for preorder from UNC press *

I cannot write my life : Islam, Arabic, and Slavery in Omar ibn Said's America

Omar ibn Said (1770–1863) was a Muslim scholar from West Africa who spent more than fifty years enslaved in North Carolina

In 1831 Omar composed a brief autobiography, the only known narrative written in Arabic by an enslaved person in North America .. more info at the site linked below

https://uncpress.org/book/9781469674674/i-cannot-write-my-life/

title: Proven Schizophrenia Treatments Keep People in School, at Work and off the Street. Why Won't Insurance Companies Cover Them?

last_post.content:
There are proven, gold standard treatments for schizophrenia -- early intervention programs with high rate of success. But ironically, they are more available to lower-income families with public insurance like Medi-Cal than to the privately insured middle class.

Freesound aims to create a huge collaborative database of audio snippets, samples, recordings, bleeps, released under Creative Commons licenses that allow their reuse. Freesound provides interesting ways of accessing these samples, allowing users to

- browse the sounds in new ways using keywords, a "sounds-like" type of browsing and more

- upload and download sounds to and from the database, under the same creative commons license

- interact with fellow sound-artists!

title: We’ve always been distracted, or at least worried that we are | Aeon Essays

last_post.content: It’s kind of startling to me that #McLuhan doesn’t get so much as a nod in this piece on #attention and extended #cognition and so on, as it could just as easily have inverted his insight that “every extension is also an amputation,” and left it at that. It’s worth reading anyway…if you can manage to maintain your focus. (For the record, I do think there’s something qualitatively different, salient and troubling about our attempts to think with screen-based media.) https://aeon.co/essays/weve-always-been-distracted-or-at-least-worried-that-we-are

title: A Final Update to Tweetbot and Twitterrific That Allows Users to Support Tapbots and The Iconfactory

last_post.content:
If you do one good Nerd Thing this week, make it tapping the 'I Don't Need a Refund' button in Tweetbot and Twitterrific.

These apps, in many ways, pioneered the modern concept of quality, indie app for iPhone. They gave us much more than they ever asked for with their subscriptions.

Join me in not needing a refund: https://www.macstories.net/stories/a-final-update-to-tweetbot-and-twitterrific-that-allows-users-to-support-tapbots-and-the-iconfactory/

On that NYT piece on conservative students being shoved out of the academy - Amy Binder and Jeff Kidder's recent book provides excellent background (Amy is soon to become a colleague, but I've loved her work for years before that). Book here - https://press.uchicago.edu/ucp/books/book/chicago/C/bo156715802.html . Summary, which I am drawing upon - here - https://nextbigideaclub.com/magazine/channels-student-activism-left-right-winning-losing-campus-politics-today-bookbite/34649/. Short version - college students are "channeled not coddled" - contra Haidt etc, you can explain their behavior in terms of organizations, not neurosis.

title: Charting the Sociotechnical Gap in Explainable AI: A Framework to Address the Gap in XAI

last_post.content:
Our new CSCW paper is about something called the "sociotechnical gap". It is the reason why Explainable AI systems sometimes fail to achieve the desired effects. We present a framework through which to understand the sociotechnical gap and address it to make better XAI systems. https://arxiv.org/abs/2302.00799

title: Can We Make Bicycles Sustainable Again?

last_post.content: "The bicycle evolved very slowly until the early 1980s and then suddenly underwent a fast succession of changes that continues up to this day." https://www.lowtechmagazine.com/2023/02/can-we-make-bicycles-sustainable-again.html "Cycling is the most sustainable form of transportation, but the bicycle is becoming increasingly damaging to the environment. The energy and material used for its production go up while its life expectancy decreases."

title: How Loneliness Reshapes the Brain | Quanta Magazine

last_post.content: "Neuroscience suggests that loneliness doesn’t necessarily result from a lack of opportunity to meet others or a fear of social interactions. Instead, circuits in our brain and changes in our behavior can trap us in a catch-22 situation: While we desire connection with others, we view them as unreliable, judgmental and unfriendly. Consequently, we keep our distance, consciously or unconsciously spurning potential opportunities for connections" https://www.quantamagazine.org/how-loneliness-reshapes-the-brain-20230228/

title: As Americans Work From Home, Europeans and Asians Head Back to the Office

last_post.content:
In Europe and Asia, people are back to the office -- in the U.S., not so much.

Why?

Well, probably because those places have sane housing policies, functional mass transit systems, smaller homes and thriving / enjoyable / walkable urban cores.

https://www.wsj.com/articles/as-americans-work-from-home-europeans-and-asians-head-back-to-the-office-db6981e1

title: Tendring District Council | Welcome to the official website of Tendring District Council

last_post.content: The Tendring District Council homepage (https://www.tendringdc.uk/) is currently the largest council homepage in the UK in terms of bytes. It has grown from ~2MB to ~15MB recently because there is a slideshow of massive, unoptimised images at the top of it. Here's my analysis of their homepage over time https://open-innovations.github.io/council-website-emissions/areas/E07000076.html It'd be helpful if anyone on here knows someone at Tendring District Council and could ask them to optimise it.

title: FTC says online counseling service BetterHelp pushed people into handing over health information – and broke its privacy promises

last_post.content:
"“Using this health information for advertising, [BetterHelp] has brought in hundreds of thousands of new Users, resulting in millions of dollars in additional revenue.”"

The punishment?

"The proposed order in the case will require BetterHelp to pay $7.8 million that will be used to provide partial refunds to people who signed up for and paid for BetterHelp’s services between August 1, 2017, and December 31, 2020. In addition, the proposed order prohibits BetterHelp from sharing consumers’ health data for advertising or sharing their personal information for re-targeting – serving ads"

BetterHelp's net worth?

Down from $45B in 2021 to $4B, but that's still 4-fucking-billion dollars...

It should be zero.

---

title: BSTJ 27: 1. January 1948: Electron Beam Deflection Tube for Pulse Code Modulation . (Sears, R.W.) : Free Download, Borrow, and Streaming : Internet Archive

last_post.content: Whoa! I had no idea that analog digital conversion and PCM (pulse code modulation) existed in 1948. And that they built their ADCs using "electronic beam deflection tubes" for turning analog values into digital code-words: https://archive.org/details/bstj27-1-44/mode/2up

title: Talking to doctors about evidence and post covid symptoms

last_post.content:
I wrote a small but perhaps in some way helpful thing about talking to doctors about evidence in trying to get post-covid care.

It includes a pdf download of some "cards" I made to help myself & friends who are trying to navigate these difficult, stressful, and time-compressed conversations.

I know how much we deal with so I tried to make it short and sweet. This is just a small thing compared to all the support these issues deserve but every little bit helps?

https://www.drcathicks.com/post/talking-to-doctors-about-evidence-and-post-covid-symptoms

Via an email (Gabriel Bodard again) to the Digital Classicist list, I've learned of the "Beyond Notability Wiki editathon, 8 March 2023 (Online and In person at the Society of Antiquaries of London" in which participation is invited.

https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/wa-jisc.exe?A2=ind2303&L=DIGITALCLASSICIST&O=D&P=60

It's sponsored by the AHRC funded project "Beyond Notability: Re-Evaluating Women’s Work in #Archaeology, #History and #Heritage 1870-1950" and they're going to be working on new/improved content for #wikipedia and #wikidata

title: What time is it on moon? Europe pushing for lunar time zone

last_post.content:
Another falsehood programmers believe about time that more programmers might have trouble with over the next couple of decades, about whether software is running in this reference frame or not:

"Clocks run faster on the moon than on Earth, gaining about 56 microseconds each day.”

From this article about ESA proposing a lunar time zone: https://apnews.com/article/moon-time-zone-space-2b0124415c14755e08a58e1b5ed5362a

Oh hey the DoJ is filing suit to stop Adobe's acquisition of Figma! That's really cool.

Over the last few years I have developed a habit of filing antitrust complaints about anticompetitive behavior. This is the first time the government has taken action on something I submitted a complaint about!

Cheers to that.
